com.coolhandsoftware.trailtrace

Class RouteDrawView

  • java.lang.Object
    • View
      • com.coolhandsoftware.trailtrace.RouteDrawView

  • public class RouteDrawView
extends View
    This View is how the MapActivity captures touch events when the user is drawing on the map. It's fragment is transacted above the map when the tracing feature is enabled. It reports the list of traced pairs to its receiver (set in ctor) when it registers that a trace has been completed (when the user lifts the finger).
    Author:
    David Cully

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      int arrowSize
      size of arrows put on end of each segment after user traces them - re-calculated in onResume from activity size

      the minimum number of points to trace through before we ignore it as unintentional input
      private Paint mPaint
      holds the color/style info for our trace, as set in ctor
      private Path mPath
      the path object we pass with our paint object to drawPath
      private IRouteDrawReceiver mReceiver
      whatever got passed in the ctor - will receive x,y coordinate reports
      (package private) java.util.ArrayList<<any>> mTracedXyCoordinates
      the list of points hit on the current singletouch trace - passed on with every ACTION_UP

    • Method Detail

      • initializeMemberVariables

        public void initializeMemberVariables(IRouteDrawReceiver receiver)
        Sets up this View's member variables - mReceiver and mPaint. Always call this from the parent Fragment!
        Parameters:
        receiver - The object that will receiver notifications when the user draws in this view.

      • onDraw

        protected void onDraw(Canvas canvas)
        this is called when the view is being rendered to the screen; it draws our path

      • onTouchEvent

        public boolean onTouchEvent(MotionEvent event)
        Allows the RouteDrawView to handle touch events, for drawing the traced routes on the screen and reporting them to the parent activity when the tracing is completed (for MapView handling). Lint drags up a warning about how I need to override performClick() if I use it in this function, but I don't use that function in here, so I disabled that specific check.

      • drawArrowAtEndOf

        public void drawArrowAtEndOf(java.util.ArrayList<<any>> mTracedXyCoordinates)
        Draws an arrow pointing towards the end of a line segment, at the midpoint of that line segment. Coordinates list must be at least 2 points long!
        Parameters:
        mTracedXyCoordinates - the list of points that makes up the segment (in pixels).

      • findPossibleXOnLine

        private <any> findPossibleXOnLine(double distance,
                                  double slope,
                                  double X,
                                  double Y)
        This function finds the two possible values of X that are a given distance away from a given point with a given slope of the line. The first X-value in the pair is the point on the line with x less than the given point. The second X-value in the pair is the point on the line with x greater than the given point.
        Parameters:
        distance - the distance from the given point to our two other points
        slope - the slope of the line these points are all on
        X - the X-value of the initial (middle) point
        Y - the Y-value of the initial (middle) point
        Returns:
        a pair of X-values for the two points, as doubles.

      • findYValsFromXVals

        private <any> findYValsFromXVals(<any> xVals,
                                 double slope,
                                 double X,
                                 double Y)
        Finds the Y-values of two points on a line from their X-coordinates.
        Parameters:
        xVals - the x-coordinates of the two points
        slope - the slope of the line
        X - the x-coordinate of some other point on the line
        Y - the y-coordinate of some other point on the line
        Returns:
        a pair of y-values - the first corresponds to the first x-value in xVals, the second two the second

      • findYFromXOnLine

        private double findYFromXOnLine(double slope,
                                double unmatchedX,
                                double X,
                                double Y)
        Point slope formula to find Y from X
        Parameters:
        slope - slope of the line
        unmatchedX - X coordinate you want a Y coordinate for
        X - x-val of a point on the line
        Y - y-val of a point on the line
        Returns:
        the Y value to match unmatchedX
